why: Understanding the real relationship between posture and pain helps you move with confidence instead of fear.

slides.title: Posture & Pain
slides.content: Poor posture alone rarely causes chronic pain; movement patterns and stress play bigger roles

slides.title: The Real Story
slides.content: Research shows that 'perfect' posture doesn't prevent pain, but movement variability and strength do

slides.title: Movement Matters
slides.content: Focus on moving frequently, varying positions, and building strength rather than maintaining 'perfect' posture

slides.title: Stress Connection
slides.content: Psychological stress and tension often contribute more to 'posture pain' than actual spinal alignment

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Perfect posture prevents all pain. Fact: Movement variability and stress management matter more.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: Set hourly reminders to change positions; focus on comfort over 'perfect' posture
